newsitem.title: UK: SmithKline says Germany clears multi-vaccine.
newsitem.headline: SmithKline says Germany clears multi-vaccine.

text.p: Anglo-American drugs group SmithKline Beecham Plc (SB) said on Monday Germany had become the first country to approve a combined vaccine which offers protection against diptheria, tetanus, whooping cough and bacterial meningitis.

In a statement the company said the approval of the multi-vaccine, which is based on SB's new anti-whooping cough injection Infanrix, "is a milestone for the development of major combination vaccines and a significant step forward in childhood vaccination."
The key ingredient in Infanrix, Pertactin, was licensed from British drugs group Medeva Plc.
A simpler version of the vaccine which protects against diptheria, whooping cough and tetanus is already approved in 11 countries, including Germany, Sweden, Switzerland and Belgium.
